values: Banner done by Due to personal security reasons, I have unfortunately come to a point where this journal is no longer safe as a public LJ. For this reason, most entries (if not all), unless otherwise noted,, are FRIENDS-ONLY. If you are not on this list and would like to be added, leave a comment here stating why you want to be added, and along with any other LJs you have as well that would like to be added, and please add me back as well first. Additionally, it's not required, but appreciated if you added my other writing LJ () as well ^_^. Thank you and have a nice day.

In keeping with a tradition I have done for the past five years, I am going to be mailing out Christmas / whatever holiday you celebrate cards to you, as my well wishes for you all who want one. This is a tradition and in the holiday spirit I intend to keep it. So, if you'd like a card, post a comment (which will be screened). For those who see this on forums or Facebook and not LiveJournal, privately message me with the following: Your RL name Your Address Your Holiday you celebrate (Christmas, Hanukkah, Solstice, etc. I'm serious - no joke holidays NOT OBLIGATED to send me a card, but if you want to, let me know and I will send you my address.

In keeping with a tradition I have done for the past four years, I am going to be mailing out Christmas / whatever holiday you celebrate cards to you, as my well wishes for you all who want one.

This is a tradition and in the holiday spirit I intend to keep it.

So, if you'd like a card, post a comment (which will be screened). For those who see this on forums or Facebook and not LiveJournal or Xanga, privately message me with the following:

Your RL name
Your Address
Your Holiday you celebrate (Christmas, Hanukkah, Solstice, etc. I'm serious - no joke holidays <_<) Thank you :)

As per regular tradition, Operation NORAD SANTA begins today.

If you would like a card, please let me know your address, and what holiday you celebrate.

I do this only because I <3 you all :D

Comments will be screened to protect the security of everyone :).

Well, I'll give a bit of post-Christmas update and such. Christmas went fairly well. Save for my Dad being sick with bronchitis followed by my sister being sick with the flu of course :P. I flew home from CA on the 22nd to find out Dad was sick, then my sister got sick the 23rd :-/. She was well enough for she and I to see I Am Legend, which I will post a review of later. For Christmas I got an Air Action 2008 calendar (of military aircraft), and my sister got me Lost Planet: Extreme Condition for the Xbox 360, Star Wars: Legacy of the Force: Fury by Aaron Allston (7th book in the series), The Greatest Generation by Tom Brokaw, some long-sleeved shirts from Old Navy, and a Aslan bookmark (Aslan being the lion from Chronicles of Narnia for those not in the know :P). I got Dad The Simpsons Movie and a Boeing pen, and I got my sister a couple of Wii games. a Boeing pen, a Boeing digital watch, and Marshmellow, this cute cuddly bear from Borders. Many people got that gift, including Jodo (), Molly (), Thom (), and 4 others from NS. I also gave Thom a year subscription to The Economist. Hopefully that will help with his write in-campaign. For many others, I sent Amazon.com gift cards and other e-cards and well wishes. All told, my bill reached around...US$940......damn I didn't break a grand w00t! :P Only minor thing about Christmas that annoys the hell out of me is that when I tried to install Crysis, the bastard CD fucking crashed my laptop! Sorry that my laptop's Core 2 Duo is .2 gigs shy of the box requirements but it can still do well on the other parts! *sigh* Now I'm stuck with this game, that I can't play on either computer, much less install, without risking another BSOD :(. Does anyone want the game? The next day I went and saw Aliens Vs. Predator: Requiem. OMG you will definitely be seeing a review of this movie :D. After much arguing with my dad I was finally able to get a rental car to be able to do errands for the time I was home in PA and hang out with people. My sister drove back to Stamford, CT as she had work on 27 Dec. I finally met Alex aka Soly (from the NS region of Taijitu), who flew all the way from Finland, even after being re-routed from France (damn you Air France >_<) to visit me and Alana, another of my best friends from that NS region. We ate some oriental food at Z.wei, this Chinese/Japanese/Thai restaurant and sushi bar in Exton. Soly finally got to try sushi, which I think he enjoyed ^_^. Alana enjoyed her gift of Marshmellow the bear, which she will now apparently put beside her penguin at home, and we finished off a fun evening with seeing The Golden Compass. The review of this movie will feature BEAR CAVALRY, though I will already point out that the amount of sexual innuendo that Alana, Alex, and myself noticed throughout the movie was highly disturbing, yet so fucking hilarious XD. Unfortunately, the rest of the weekend was crap as I then got a mild flu, care of my dad, who's still suffering from bronchitis as of today but is much improved compared to 22 Dec. when I first flew in. I'm getting a bit better now as well, after downing 4 tablespoons total of Robitussin cough syrup and half a bag of Halls Defence Vitamin C Assorted Citrus cough drops....I think I'm down to like 12 out of the original 30 that were supposed to be in that bag o.o. Anyhoo, I'm sure some of you are still curious as to what the hell happened to me from Jul. 2006 up to when I started updating again since I came home for my paid holiday. I appreciate your patience all of you, and promise that an an update will come as soon as I can, hopefully either tonight or at the end of this week. My other LJ, , will still be used for assorted commentaries and my non-technical writings hopefully. I have to contact the Reporter office and see what I can do about getting access to some of the articles I wrote in the 2006-2007 school year at RIT. With that said, some of you have also been sent e-cards about this. I couldn't send to everyone, but it is still the same point. Thanks for the memories in 2007, both the good and bad. Thanks for being my friend and being there for me when I needed it. I hope we can continue to be friends and better ones at that next year. May God bless you and your family and loved ones and that you celebrate the New Year safely and responsibly. Happy New Year to everyone! See you in 2008 ^_^ :)

To all my friends and those whom I hold dear: May you have a safe and Happy Holidays, Merry Christmas, Happy Boxing Day. Celebrate your holidays well, safely, and with family. Be well, and be safe. Remember your friends, and those who cannot be there, for they are still with you somehow, in your heart. Mum, Max, and Minnie may not be with me, but I know they are still here spiritually, celebrating it all with us. My father and sister are doing well, though I have to take care of them both as they are sick. I hope I just don't get their illness :P I'm home in West Chester, PA now, until New Year's Day, flying in from Long Beach, CA -> Phoenix, AZ -> Washington, DC -> Philadelphia, PA. I hope you all enjoy the rest of your holiday, and before I go, I would like to leave you: A Different Chrismas Poem This was written by a Lt. Cmdr of a US Naval logisitcs unit in Iraq The embers glowed softly, and in their dim light, I gazed round the room and I cherished the sight. My wife was asleep, her head on my chest, My daughter beside me, angelic in rest. Outside the snow fell, a blanket of white, Transforming the yard to a winter delight. The sparkling lights in the tree I believe, Completed the magic that was Christmas Eve. My eyelids were heavy, my breathing was deep, Secure and surrounded by love I would sleep. In perfect contentment, or so it would seem, So I slumbered, perhaps I started to dream. The sound wasn't loud, and it wasn't too near, But I opened my eyes when it tickled my ear. Perhaps just a cough, I didn't quite know, Then the sure sound of footsteps outside in the snow. My soul gave a tremble, I struggled to hear, And I crept to the door just to see who was near. Standing out in the cold and dark of the night, A lone figure stood, his face weary and tight. A soldier, I puzzled, some twenty years old, Perhaps a Marine, huddled here in the cold. Alone in the dark, he looked up and smiled, Standing watch over me, and my wife and my child. "What are you doing?" I asked without fear, "Come in this moment, it's freezing out here! Put down your pack, brush the snow from your sleeve, You should be at home on a cold Christmas Eve!" For barely a moment I saw his eyes shift, Away from the cold and the snow blown in drifts. To the window that danced with a warm fire's light Then he sighed and he said "It's really all right, "I'm out here by choice. I'm here every night. It's my duty to stand at the front of the line, That separates you from the darkest of times. No one had to ask or beg or implore me, I'm proud to stand here like my fathers before me. My Gramps died at Pearl on a day in December," Then he sighed, "That's a Christmas 'Gram always remembers. "My dad stood his watch in the jungles of 'Nam, And now it is my turn and so, here I am. I've not seen my own son in more than a while, But my wife sends me pictures, he's sure got her smile." Then he bent and he carefully pulled from his bag, The red, white, and blue...an American flag. "I can live through the cold and the being alone, Away from my family, my house and my home. "I can stand at my post through the rain and the sleet, I can sleep in a foxhole with little to eat. I can carry the weight of killing another, Or lay down my life with my sister and brother.. "Who stand at the front against any and all, To ensure for all time that this this flag will not fall. So go back inside," he said, "harbor no fright, Your family is waiting and I'll be all right." "But isn't there something I can do, at the least, Give you money," I asked, "or prepare you a feast? It seems all too little for all that you've done, For being away from your wife and your son." Then his eye welled a tear that held no regret, "Just tell us you love us, and never forget. To fight for our rights back home while we're gone, To stand your own watch, no matter how long. "For when we come home, either standing or dead, To know you remember we fought and we bled. Is payment enough, and with that we will trust, That we mattered to you as you mattered to us." Please feel free to share the above poem if you wished. Even if you disagreed with that message, I still will wish you all a safe and Happy Holidays. Enjoy it well, and thank you all for your friendship and the good times. You all mean so much to me :)

This is a running tally of books I've read, for my own records: Non-fiction books, In Alphabetical Order of Author's Last Name: The Art of War - by Sun Tzu (6th Century BC) Pocket Edition, Translated by Thomas Cleary (1991) Fiction, In Alphabetical Order of Author's Last Name: To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee (1960) The Call of the Wild by Jack London (1903) Star Wars Novels & Comics, In Chronological Order: The Han Solo Trilogy: - The Paradise Snare by A. C. Crispin (1997) - The Hutt Gambit by A. C. Crispin (1997) - Rebel Dawn by A. C. Crispin (1997) The Han Solo Adventures: - Han Solo at Stars' End by Brian Daley (1979) - Han Solo's Revenge by Brian Daley (1979) - Han Solo and the Lost Legacy by Brian Daley (1980) Dark Forces: Soldier for the Empire by William C. Dietz (1997) Galaxy of Fear: Eaten Alive by John Whitman (1997) Splinter of the Mind's Eye by Alan Dean Foster (1978) Tales of the Bounty Hunters edited by Kevin J. Anderson (1996) - Therefore I Am: The Tale of IG-88 by Kevin J. Anderson - Payback: The Tale of Dengar by Dave Wolverton - The Prize Pelt: The Tale of Bossk by Kathy Tyers - Of Possible Futures: The Tale of Zuckuss and 4-LOM by M. Shayne Bell - The Last One Standing: The Tale of Boba Fett by Daniel Keys Moran Shadows of the Empire by Steve Perry (1996) The Truce at Bakura by Kathy Tyers (1993) X-wing: Rogue Squadron by Michael A. Stackpole (1996) X-wing: Wedge's Gamble by Michael A. Stackpole (1996) X-wing: The Krytos Trap by Michael A. Stackpole (1996) X-wing: The Bacta War by Michael A. Stackpole (1997) Dark Empire by Tom Veitch & Cam Kennedy (1993) The Jedi Academy Trilogy - Jedi Search by Kevin J. Anderson (1994) - Dark Apprentice by Kevin J. Anderson (1994) - Champions of the Force by Kevin J. Anderson (1994) Children of the Jedi by Barbara Hambly (1995) Darksaber by Kevin J. Anderson (1995) Planet of Twilight by Barbara Hambly (1997) The Crystal Star by Vonda N. McIntyre (1994) The Black Fleet Crisis Trilogy - Before the Storm by Michael P. Kube-McDowell (1996) - Shield of Lies by Michael P. Kube-McDowell (1996) - Tyrant's Test by Michael P. Kube-McDowell (1996) The New Rebellion by Kristine Kathryn Rusch (1996) The Corellian Trilogy - Ambush at Corellia by Roger MacBride Allen (1995) - Assault at Selonia by Roger MacBride Allen (1995) - Showdown at Centerpoint by Roger MacBride Allen (1995) Currently Reading: The Art of War by Niccolo Machiavelli (1521), Translated by Henry Neville (2006) The Pacific War, 1931-1945: A Critical Perspective on Japan's Role in World War II by Saburo Ienaga (1968), Translated by Frank Baldwin (1978) This list will be continually updated as I read more and have time to remember what has been read.

As some of you may know, yesterday, 16 Apr. 2007, was the Virginia Tech Massacre . They know identified the shooter as a South Korean native on a US visa, a 4th year English major. I had a friend who goes there, and she's all right. I had also another friend, an NSer, who was visiting the campus as he was considering going to that school next year, and his account as he told me: "For those of you who don't already know, Virginia Tech was struck by the worst mass shooting in US history today. Currently, 33 are dead, along with the gunman. The attack took place mainly in Norris Hall (there was a separate, possibly related attack earlier in the morning that killed 2). Unfortunately, I was in the adjacent Burres Hall (Administration) on a college visit. I, unfortunately, heard the shots, and watched police arrive, surround the building, blow down the doors and storm it. At that time, Burres Hall was locked down and placed under guard due to suspicions that it may be targetted as a center for administration. Fortunately, that was not the case. At the time, I did not think it was affecting me too greatly, and thought nothing more. However, having heard the death toll since, and finally connecting sounds that I initially thought were construction sounds with really being gunshots, and that most of each shot connected, and that had it been two hours later, I would've been in that very building, I find myself very, very shaken." No matter what people say, there's only one person to blame for this. Not the administration. Not US firearms law. Not media. Not the family of the shooter, but the shooter himself. He will atone for his actions in the presence of God himself, as He's the only one who can tell his fate. RIT had a memorial service today, followed by ringing the bell 33 times, for each one lost. For everyone else, please pray for the families of those lost, for everyone at Virginia Tech, and for all those 32 souls lost. May God grant them all peace in the afterlife and grant the grieving the strength to get through this, in this dark hour. VT, RIT, and the US are with you. Today, we are all Hokies.

This was taken from Danelle on FB:

A farmer had some puppies he needed to sell. He painted a sign advertising
the 4 pups. And set about nailing it to a post on the edge of his yard. As
he was driving the last nail into the post, he felt a tug on his overalls.
He looked down into the eyes of little boy.
"Mister," he said, "I want to buy one of your puppies."
"Well," said the farmer,
as he rubbed the sweat off the back of his neck, "These puppies come from
fine parents and cost a good deal of money."
The boy dropped his head for a moment.
Then reaching deep into his pocket,
he pulled out a handful of change
and held it up to the farmer.
"I've got thirty-nine cents.
Is that enough to take a look?"
"Sure," said the farmer.
And with that he let out a whistle.
"Here, Dolly!" he called.
Out from the doghouse and down the ramp ran
Dolly followed by four little balls of fur.
The little boy pressed his face against the chain link fence. His eyes
danced with delight.
As the dogs made their way to the fence,
the little boy noticed something else stirring inside the doghouse.
Slowly another little ball appeared, this one noticeably smaller. Down the
ramp it slid. Then in a somewhat awkward manner, the little pup began
hobbling toward the others, doing its best to catch up...
"I want that one," the little boy said, pointing to the runt. The farmer
knelt down at the boy's side and said, "Son, you don't want that puppy. He
will never be able to run and play with you like these other dogs would."
With that the little boy stepped back from the fence, reached down, and
began rolling up one leg of his trousers.
In doing so he revealed a steel brace running down both sides of his leg
attaching itself to a specially made shoe.
Looking back up at the farmer, he said,
"You see sir, I don't run too well myself,
and he will need someone who understands."
With tears in his eyes, the farmer reached down and picked up the little
pup.
Holding it carefully handed it to the little boy.
"How much?" asked the little boy. "No charge," answered the farmer,
"There's no charge for love."
The world is full of people who need someone who understands.
It's National Friendship Week.

I couldn't believe it at first, but then I saw the news: RIT Closed Due to Icy Conditions Holy fuck! THis is the first time in nearly eight years that this has happened!!! THIS IS FUCKING SWEET! Well, someone should probably let the lads over at Emergency Preparedness about the info, as they seem to believe classes and activities are still on for today :P. Wow. Well, guess that gives me 5 hours extra time today! Huzzah! This is a victory indeed! More info later....

This is for all my friends who I've not had a chance to contact as of late, and to pretty much anyone who sees this: Happy New Year everyone!! May 2007, the Year of the Boar, be a prosperous and good one for you all, and for those Bond fans, may it be an awesome Year of 007 :) I'll probably do a more detailed update later today or in the early morning, once some work I have to do clears. As usual, it will be friends-only/protected. If you are curious as to what it is, feel free to set up an account here . It's free, and they've made a lot of improvments since I first signed up in Dec. 2003. Take care everyone and hope the rest of your holiday vacation was/is well!

MERRY CHRISTMAS & HAPPY HOLIDAYS EVERYONE!!!!
May everyone enjoy these blessed times safely and responsibly, and that those you celebrate it with enjoy it the same way as well :)

May the men and women of the Armed Forces of Australia, the UK, Canada, the US, and all our other allies fighting for us be safe and enjoy it as well

God bless them, God bless my family, and my friends.  God watch over the souls of my late Mum, two dogs, my Grandmums, and my Uncle Gopi, and the departed of anyone else who cannnot be with us physically to celebrate it with us, but are here in spirit.

Merry Christmas, Happy Kwanzaa, Happy Hanukkah, Happy Winter Solstice, Happy Festivus :P, and Happy Holidays everyone!

This video contains an excellent example of "bullbaiting" which is something Scientologists drill to do. The idea is to try to cave in the person who is being assaulted.

What American accent do you have?
Your Result: The Inland North

You may think you speak "Standard English straight out of the dictionary" but when you step away from the Great Lakes you get asked annoying questions like "Are you from Wisconsin?" or "Are you from Chicago?" Chances are you call carbonated drinks "pop."

The Midland
North Central
The West
The Northeast
The South
Philadelphia
Boston
What American accent do you have?
Take More Quizzes
Dammit, it is SODA, not pop! Pop is what you call your dad, soda is what you ask your pop to get to drink, other than alcohol! And I thought my accent was a bit more British than anything in the North...

For those who have been patient....

For those who have been understanding....

For those who have kept their friendship with me....

For those who started a friendship with me....

For those who have inquired as to my status, in any aspect....

For those who show they care when I needed it....

I thank each and every one of you.  I know many of you wondered why I haven't updated in a while, or when, if ever, I plan to update.  At this point, I will update as soon as I can.  If it's not work, or class, it's something else that piles up in front of me that needs to be taken care of first.  I'm just glad those of you who read this understand.  

The weekend was fun, busy, and exhausting, amongst other things.  An update will come, as I said, along with pictures, amongst other things, like a poll, and a meme, and some reviews ^_^.

Those of you who can see this, I suggest you get an LJ (it's free) and friend me if you want to see all that, because I'll still keep most, if not all, of my entries as friends-only for security reasons.

I hope all is well with each of you and I hope to talk to you all soon.

Your good friend,
Govind
